greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of primes p with n^2 < p < (n+1)^2.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
example: a(2)=12 because between 4 and 9 there are two primes (5 and 7) with sum equal to 12.
maple: a:=proc(n) local s,j: s:=0: for j from n^2 to (n+1)^2 do if isprime(j)=true then s:=s+j else s:=s: fi od end: seq(a(n),n=1..50); # _Emeric Deutsch_, Jul 01 2005
mathematica: f[n_] := Plus @@ Prime[ Range[PrimePi[n^2] + 1, PrimePi[(n + 1)^2]]]; Table[ f[n], {n, 44}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 01 2005 *)
results.author: _Giovanni Teofilatto_, Jun 30 2005
ext: Edited, corrected and extended by _Emeric Deutsch_, _Robert G. Wilson v_ and _Rick L. Shepherd_, Jul 01 2005
